extraDetails.quizTitle: DKT questions on Alcohol and Drugs

referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Multiplication
referralLink.description: Are you ready for DKT test? Try simulation test before you go for final test.

referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Substraction
referralLink.description: Government website for all informationunder one umbrella.

options: Drink black coffee.
Wait. The time depends on how much you have drunk.
Have a glass of water.
questions.qn: To reduce the effect of alcohol before driving or riding you should -

options: Not to drink any alcohol.
Drink 1 nip of spirits (30 ml or 1 oz).
Drink 1 middy (285 ml) of light (low alcohol) beer.
questions.qn: Before driving a motor vehicle or riding a motor cycle it is safest -

options: No, if you are a learner driver.
No, if you say you haven't been drinking alcohol.
Yes, always.
questions.qn: Is it an offence to refuse to take a POLICE breath test?

options: The alcohol will have less effect than if taken alone.
It can have a particularly bad effect on your driving ability.
Your ability to react to emergencies will improve.
questions.qn: If you take medicine and then drink alcohol -

If you are driving a bus, taxi, hire-car, heavy motor vehicle (over 13.9 tonnes Gross Vehicle Mass), or a vehicle with a dangerous load, it is an offence when the level of alcohol in your blood reaches -

options: Has no effect on your driving ability.
Improves your driving ability.
Will affect your reactions and judgement.
questions.qn: Having 1 or 2 alcoholic drinks before driving -

options: Drive, but avoid using freeways
Be aware that your abilities are decreased.
Spend more time than usual looking in the mirrors.
questions.qn: Even if you feel unaffected after drinking alcohol, you should -

options: It slows down how quickly your brain works.
It speeds your brain up so you can work better.
It makes you calm down and think more clearly.
questions.qn: Alcohol is a depressant. This means -

options: Be able to drive the same as you normally can.
Be able to pay close attention to details in the traffic.
Misjudge speed (your own and others).
questions.qn: After drinking alcohol you could -

options: Wait for one hour after your last drink before you drive home.
Organise before hand a way of getting home where you are not the driver.
After you have had a few drinks, start to think about how you will get home.
questions.qn: If you are going out and going to drink alcohol, the best way to avoid having to drink and drive is to -

options: More serious.
Less serious.
About the same
questions.qn: When drivers have been drinking, the crashes they are involved in are generally -

options: About 50%.
About 30%.
About 10%.
questions.qn: On Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights, how many serious crashes involve alcohol?

options: Exercising and drinking black coffee.
Buying a breathalyser (alcohol measuring instrument).
Not drinking any alcohol.
questions.qn: What is the safest way to stay under the legal alcohol limit?

options: Zero.
questions.qn: If you hold a learner or provisional licence class what is the Blood Alcohol Concentration (BAC) limit?

options: Find out from your doctor or chemist whether the medicine or drug will affect your driving and act accordingly.
Only drive during the day after taking the medicine or drug.
Only drive a motor car not a heavy vehicle.
questions.qn: If you are taking any sort of medicine, you should -

options: Have some food in your stomach.
Plan to have some other person with you.
Know what the effects of the drug are.
questions.qn: Before taking any drugs and then driving it is most important to -

options: May drive only in light traffic.
Must not drive.
Should drink coffee before driving.
questions.qn: If you have used illegal drugs you -

options: You may drive only in daylight hours.
You must have a passenger to help you drive.
You must not drive.
questions.qn: If you are affected by a legal drug, such as a medicine (e.g. cold or allergy tablets) -

options: Read the label and confirm they are not prescription drugs and there are no special warnings on the label.
Ask your friend if the tablets have affected them.
Drink a large glass of milk because this reduces the adverse effects of medicines and drugs.
questions.qn: You want to drive your car but you have a very bad headache. A friend gives you some of their headache tablets to kill the pain. What should you do before you take these tablets?

options: Ask your passengers to let you know if you are not driving as well as you should.
Drive carefully around your local streets to see if you are affected.
Ask your doctor if the combination of drugs will make it dangerous to drive.
questions.qn: If you are taking several medications and you want to drive, you should -
